thread.title: Freep columnists, special guest split on Lions-Cardinals prediction
thread.title_full: Freep columnists, special guest split on Lions-Cardinals prediction

author: freep.com
title: Freep columnists, special guest split on Lions-Cardinals prediction
text:
MORE
Mitch Albom
• Cardinals 24, Lions 14: Too many injuries, too many mistakes, too little blocking, too much history.
Jeff Seidel
• Lions 17, Cardinals 14: This goes against my better judgement, picking the Lions, but they are at home. The Lions' defense showed signs of life against Seattle. And Matthew Stafford proved he can be effective — late in the game. If only Stafford could move the team like that all the time.
Drew Sharp
• Cardinals 24, Lions 20: The Lions recover emotionally from their disastrous finish Monday night in Seattle. And rumor has it they'll actually have an offensive play that will gain more than 40 yards from the line of scrimmage. But they're simply facing a much better team that has more to play for in Week 5 than the Lions. The Lions can't blame the refs for this loss, leaving them to revert back to the dozens of other excuses for losing.
This week's guest picker: Joseph Friedli (Photo: Courtesy photo)
Today's guest picker is Joseph Friedli of East Lansing, who won the Free Press Twitter contest last week by picking a 17-10 Seahawks win over the Lions.
• Lions 20, Cardinals 17: A comeback by Matthew Stafford doesn't fall short this time. The return of DeAndre Levy and a huge game by a motivated Calvin Johnson will ignite the Lions to their first victory.
You pick 'em!
Lions fans! Join us for a new,
weekly contest during the season. Predict the score of this week's Lions game, using the #FreepPicks hashtag on Twitter. Include both teams' names in your prediction (example: Cardinals 8, Lions 7 #FreepPicks).
Entries will be accepted until kickoff, but in case of a tie, the first person to have submitted the winning score wins. And what does the winner win? Fame, not fortune. The winner will join our columnists in predicting the following week's Lions game in the newspaper and online.
